item.title: How to sweep a multi-account Bitcoin Electrum wallet
item.description: How to sweep a multi-account Bitcoin Electrum wallet through Trezor if you can't export the mnemonic.

item.title: Don't be stuck at dev environment setup!
item.description: One of the worst feelings as a developer is not able to work on what you set out to do. Instead, you spent the entire day setting up the repository on your local system. And what's worse? It's the first week of your new job.

item.title: Python Caveats #1: How to put multiline comments in Python dict?
item.description: How to put multiline comments in python dict? Should we use triple quotes style or multiline hashes?

item.title: T-shaped smart creatives
item.description: What do they bring to the table?

item.title: So long, HackerEarth!
item.description: Thank you, HackerEarth. I'll always cherish the memories we've created. Goodbye!

item.title: How to become better at reading and debugging code
item.description: Reading unknown code is usually intimidating, however, our ability to read and debug code matters more than we can write, yet we are never taught anything about it. Let's see how we can improve our ability to read and debug code.

item.title: Is it boring working in Web Development startups?
item.description: Whenever I get in conversation with junior undergrads, they often ask if it is monotonous and boring working on web technologies. I used to think the same way 3-4 years ago, however, after having the first hand experience, I think otherwise.

item.title: A millennial's thoughts on embarking as a Software Engineer
item.description: We, the new generation of software engineers, love to talk about creating an impact. We attend overnight hackathons to build the next big thing. Good that we can build an app in 24 hours, but is it really a production ready codebase? Are we carried away with the agility brought in by our generation?

item.title: Extended Euclid Algorithm to find GCD and Bézout's coefficients
item.description: We will see how to use Extended Euclid's Algorithm to find GCD of two numbers. It also gives us Bézout's coefficients (x, y) such that ax + by = gcd(a, b). We will discuss and implement all of the above problems in Python and C++

item.title: How to find Multiplicative Inverse of a number modulo M?
item.description: What is Multiplicative Inverse? What is Modular Multiplicative Inverse? How to find Modular Multiplicative Inverse? How to find Multiplicative Inverse of a number modulo M i.e. under M? How to find Modular Multiplicative Inverse in an efficient way? We will discuss and implement all of the above problems in Python and C++
